text.p: Ambassador Apartments Inc said Friday it purchased four garden apartment properties containing 931 units.
Two of the properties are located in West Palm Beach, and the others are located in Daytona Beach and Deland, Fla.
The total purchase price was approximately $38 million, or $40,800 per unit, including closing costs.
The sellers were affiliates of the Whitehall Fund, represented by Goldman, Sachs & Co.
The purchase increases the company's portfolio to 43 properties, containing 12,457 apartments, of which 1,131 are located in Florida.
Funds for the acquisition were provided by equity proceeds from the recent sale of convertible preferred shares and the company's line of credit from Bank One Arizona.
The company said it will finance a portion of the acquisition of the property with tax exempt bonds.
As part of the purchase, Ambassador also acquired $38.95 million face amount of tax exempt bonds, which are secured by first mortgages on the properties.
